intro: Lonicera quadrifolia, commonly known as the evergreen honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves that remain green throughout the year. The plant produces fragrant, tubular flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring. Its red, berry-like fruits are edible and attract various wildlife. Lonicera quadrifolia thrives in partial to full shade and is often found in woodlands and moist soils.
